main event: On November 2, 1953, six unidentified flying objects were observed over Idlewild Airport in New York.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be reddish-orange and appeared to make sudden turns and high climbs., They were observed for approximately 1.5 minutes., One witness compared the size of the objects to a fifty cent piece held at arm's length., The weather at the time was fair with scattered clouds and the sun setting., Tower personnel and traffic control noted nothing unusual during the sighting.
witness description: An enlisted man with the United States Navy, employed by Pan American Airways.
